Articles.Content:
It would be nice to get some visual temperature indicator showing how close to explosion craft is.

I think it should make calculations depend on part closest to destruction and show it as percentage.
Alt+F12 can help, but I wholly agree. Congratulations on 50th post!
Something I probably could write but I don't know how to add visual elements to screen ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Oh!...You want an indicator for your CRAFT?!?....I thought you were asking for an in-game monitor for your PC!!.... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) ... Thats what "I" need...my laptop gets in the red all the time, even with a Thermaltake Massive23 fan under it...

Work-in-progress mod in signature.

Or just [click this link](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116773).
The latest version of NanoGauges has a "external temperature" gauge included.

[Thermometer!](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/118087-Thermometer-v1-0-3)

You will need this, and make sure to turn those temp gauges off with F10.

This mod allows for you to view the part's real temperature and it's max temp, and it will start to highlight the overheating part.
